ClinicalDocument.title: Community Health and Hospitals: Procedure Note

code.codeSystemName: Personal Relationship Role Type Value Set

list.item: Recurrent GI bleed of unknown etiology; hypotension perhaps secondary to this but as likely secondary to polypharmacy.
Acute on chronic anemia secondary to #1.
Azotemia, acute renal failure with volume loss secondary to #1.
Hyperkalemia secondary to #3 and on ACE and K+ supplement.
Other chronic diagnoses as noted above, currently stable.

section.title: Procedure Indications
section.text: The procedure is performed for screening in a low risk individual.

section.title: PROCEDURE DESCRIPTION
section.text: The patient was brought to the operating room, placed in the supine position, and general anesthesia was induced. A detailed technical narrative of a laparoscopic appendectomy from initial incision to placement of any dressings follows.

text.content: Conscious sedation with propofol 200 mg IV

section.title: Procedure Findings
section.text: A 6 mm sessile polyp was found in the ascending colon and removed by snare, no cautery. Bleeding was controlled. Moderate diverticulosis and hemorrhoids were incidentally noted.

section.title: Complications
section.text: Asthmatic symptoms while under general anesthesia.

section.title: Procedure Disposition
section.text: The patient was taken to the Endoscopy Recovery Unit in stable condition.

tr.td:
Traveled to Singapore, Malaysia and Bali with
my family.
